stork.feather

Class URI.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • stork.feather.Path
      • stork.feather.URI
        • stork.feather.URI.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    URI

    public static class URI.Builder
extends URI
    This is the default mutable URI implementation. A builder utility, similar in spirit to StringBuilder, for efficiently creating URIs component-wise.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class stork.feather.URI

      • userInfo

        public java.lang.String userInfo()
        Description copied from class: URI
        Get the user-info segment in the form "[user][:pass]", if this is a URL. If the password is not included in the URI, this is equivalent to URI.username(). If the username is not included in the URI, this returns the result of URI.password() preceded with a colon.
        Specified by:
        userInfo in class URI
        Returns:
        The user-info segment of the URI.

      • isMutable

        public boolean isMutable()
        Description copied from class: URI
        Return whether or not this URI object is mutable. A mutable URI can have its components modified directly, allowing multiple modification operations to be performed more efficiently. An immutable URI can serve as a key in a hash table without breaking the hash table key contract.
        Specified by:
        isMutable in class URI
        Returns:
        Whether or not this URI object is mutable.
